medical_centers.name: Stanford Sleep Surgery Center
medical_centers.address: 450 Broadway, Pavilion B, 2nd Floor, Redwood City, CA 94063
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Surgery, Obstructive Sleep Apnea
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Pedro Martins Gomes de Oliveira, MD (Oral and maxillofacial surgeon), Robson Capasso, MD (Head and neck surgeon), Abraham G. Hsieh, MD (Head and neck surgeon)
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Distraction Osteogenesis Maxillary Expansion, Drug-Induced Sleep Endoscopy, Nasal Surgery, Palate Surgery, Skeletal Surgery, Tongue Surgery, Upper Airway Stimulation
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Ranked one of the top ENT hospitals in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
medical_centers.research_programs: Active research program to continue developing better ways to diagnose and treat sleep disorders. Pioneering clinical trials that give eligible patients access to promising therapies available only at Stanford Health Care.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The Sleep Surgery Program is part of Stanford Health Care Ear, Nose, and Throat (ENT). They have been performing surgery for sleep disorders for over 35 years.

medical_centers.name: The Penn Sleep Centers
medical_centers.address: 3624 Market Street, Suite 201, Philadelphia, PA 19104
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep and circadian research, personalized medicine
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Raj Dedhia, MD; Julianna Rodin, MD
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Nasal reconstruction, soft tissue surgery, hypoglossal nerve stimulation, skeletal procedures
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: The center's mission is to develop and support programs of excellence in sleep and circadian research and education.
medical_centers.research_programs: Actively recruiting for studies on cryolysis for OSA (ARCTIC-3, ICE-OSA) and phenotyping obstruction patterns with DISE (DISE-PhOP). Past studies include research on hypoglossal nerve stimulation and its effects on cardiovascular health.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans are accepted, including Aetna, AmeriHealth, Blue Cross & Blue Shield, Cigna, Humana, Independence Blue Cross, Keystone Health Plan East, Medicare, and UnitedHealthcare. A comprehensive list is available on their website.
medical_centers.notes: Patient reviews are mixed, with some patients praising the knowledgeable staff and others expressing frustration with the administrative aspects of the center.

medical_centers.name: Cleveland Clinic Sleep Disorders Center
medical_centers.address: 8800 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, OH 44106
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep apnea, Snoring, Insomnia, Restless legs syndrome, Narcolepsy, Parasomnias, Circadian rhythm disorders
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Alan Kominsky, MD (Head, Section of Surgical Sleep and Snoring), Loutfi Aboussouan, MD (Pulmonary, Critical Care & Sleep Medicine), Harneet Walia, MD (Sleep Medicine), Reena Mehra, MD, MS (Sleep Medicine)
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Inspire upper airway stimulation, Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Tonsillectomy, Nasal surgery, Palatal z-plasty, Tongue reduction surgery, Maxillomandibular advancement, Genioglossus advancement
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine
medical_centers.research_programs: The center's research focuses on the intersection of sleep disorders with heart disease, neurodegeneration, seizure disorders, and pulmonary disease. They are also investigating novel neuromodulation therapies for sleep disorders and have a large clinical trials program for hypersomnia.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The center is known for its multidisciplinary approach, with specialists from various fields. They also offer a free mobile app for sleep assessment called 'SLEEP by Cleveland Clinic™'.

medical_centers.name: Mayo Clinic Sleep Surgery - Rochester, Minnesota
medical_centers.address: 200 First St. SW, Rochester, MN 55905
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep apnea surgery, soft tissue surgery, upper airway stimulation, orthognathic surgery
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Stephen F. Bansberg, M.D., Semirra L. Bayan, M.D.
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Soft tissue surgery, tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Upper airway stimulation therapy (Inspire device), Orthognathic surgery, maxillomandibular advancement (MMA) surgery
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine
medical_centers.research_programs: Active in obstructive sleep apnea research to develop new solutions that improve treatment.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The Sleep Surgery Clinic at Mayo Clinic's campus in Minnesota provides specialized treatment for adults and children with obstructive sleep apnea who haven't found relief with other treatment options, such as continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP).

medical_centers.name: Mount Sinai Sleep Surgery Program
medical_centers.address: 5 East 98th Street, 8th Floor, New York, NY 10029
medical_centers.specializations: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), sleep-disordered breathing, Inspire Therapy implant device, robotic surgery
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Fred Lin, MD, Head and Neck Surgery; Gregory P Tsai, MD, Head and Neck Surgery, Sleep Medicine
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Uvulopalatal flap, Expansion sphincteroplasty, Palatal Advancement, Tonsillectomy for obstructive sleep apnea, Nasal surgery for sleep apnea, Septoplasty, Turbinate reduction, Nasal valve collapse, Jaw (maxillomandibular) expansion or advancement, Inspire Therapy implant, Robotic surgery, Tongue advancement or ablation surgery
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Information not readily available on the website.
medical_centers.research_programs: Mount Sinai is involved in research for the Inspire Therapy implant, the use of Gabapentin for post-operative pain control, and robotic surgery for sleep apnea. They also take a multidisciplinary approach to care and research, partnering with other divisions like Rhinology.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The program emphasizes a multidisciplinary approach, collaborating with experts in Pulmonary and Sleep Medicine, Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, Neurology, and Bariatric Surgery. They also use the SNORE-25 quality of life measure to track patient outcomes.

medical_centers.name: UCLA Sleep Disorders Center
medical_centers.address: 10833 Le Conte Ave. Center for Health Sciences [CHS], Suite BE-216, Los Angeles, CA 90095
medical_centers.specializations: Surgical evaluation and treatment of obstructive sleep apnea and snoring, Drug-induced sleep endoscopy, Personalized medicine approach, Advanced palate surgery techniques, Inspire Upper Airway Stimulation®
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Ravi S. Aysola, MD, Director, UCLA Sleep Disorders Center; Eric J. Kezirian, MD, MPH, Otolaryngology
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Drug-induced sleep endoscopy, Expansion sphincter pharyngoplasty, Lateral pharyngoplasty, Australian modified palatopharyngoplasty, Inspire Upper Airway Stimulation®
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Recognized by colleagues around the world as leaders in the surgical evaluation and treatment of obstructive sleep apnea and snoring; Continuous accreditation by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine.
medical_centers.research_programs: Actively involved in basic and clinical research aimed at determining the conditions that result in sleep disturbances and identifying successful treatments. Currently conducting research funded by the National Institutes of Health examining the physical causes of obstructive sleep apnea and also other potential causes that may be treatable with medications.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High, major referral center for especially-challenging cases.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance, including Medicare and most HMO and PPO plans.
medical_centers.notes: The center has been established for over 50 years and has the largest group of clinical sleep researchers in the United States. They use a personalized medicine approach, and Dr. Kezirian developed the VOTE Classification scoring system for drug-induced sleep endoscopy.

medical_centers.name: Massachusetts Eye and Ear
medical_centers.address: 243 Charles Street, Boston, MA 02114
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep medicine, Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Noah S. Siegel, MD; Phillip A. Huyett, MD; John M. Dobrowski, MD, FACS; Phoebe K. Yu, MD, MPH; Roxanne C. Bavarian, DMD, DMSc; Karen Lee, MD; Donald G. Keamy, Jr., MD, MPH; Gillian R. Diercks, MD, MPH; Christopher J. Hartnick, MD, MS; Nicolas Y. BuSaba, MD, FACS
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire), CPAP, BiPAP, and other surgical and non-surgical treatments for sleep apnea and snoring.
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Recognized by Inspire Medical Systems in 2021 as a 'Physician of Excellence' program.
medical_centers.research_programs: Active clinical trials, including a multi-centered trial for the use of the hypoglossal nerve stimulator in children with Down syndrome and severe OSA. Research focus on sleep disorders and their treatments.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High. Over 300 hypoglossal nerve stimulator implantations since 2019.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The program has four physicians board-certified in both otolaryngology-head and neck surgery and sleep medicine, more than any other sleep program in the US. They offer specialized sleep services at 10 locations throughout Eastern Massachusetts.

medical_centers.name: Vanderbilt Sleep Surgery Program
medical_centers.address: 719 Thompson Lane, Suite 30400, Nashville, TN 37204
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Apnea, Snoring, Hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire therapy)
medical_centers.key_surgeons: David T. Kent, MD (Director of Sleep Surgery, Director of Translational Research, Associate Professor), Holly Budnick, APRN
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire therapy), Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure (BIPAP), In-office snoring and sleep apnea treatments, Lifestyle changes, Nasal airway surgery, Oral (dental) appliances, Positional therapy
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Designated as an Excellence Program Care Team by Inspire Medical Systems.
medical_centers.research_programs: Active research in the neurophysiology of the upper airway, including a $4 million NIH-funded study on ansa cervicalis stimulation (ACS) led by Dr. David T. Kent. The program also offers access to other clinical trials.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance, including Aetna, BlueCross BlueShield, Cigna, Humana, and Medicare.
medical_centers.notes: First program in Tennessee to offer hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire therapy).

medical_centers.name: The Johns Hopkins Center for Snoring and Sleep Apnea Surgery
medical_centers.address: 601 N. Caroline St., Baltimore, MD 21287
medical_centers.specializations: Obstructive sleep apnea, snoring, hypoglossal nerve stimulation therapy
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Kevin M. Motz, MD (Director, Division of Sleep Surgery); James H. Clark, MBBChBAO; David W. Eisele, MD; Matthew Lewis Kashima, MD; Luu Van Pham, MD; Robin Yang, MD DDS
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Nasal Surgery (Septoplasty, Nasal turbinate reduction, Nasal valve reconstruction), Palatal Surgery (Expansion Pharyngoplasty, Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Tonsillectomy, Palate radiofrequency, Palatal implantation), Base of Tongue Surgery (Lingual tonsillectomy, Partial midline glossectomy, Radiofrequency to the base of tongue, Genioglossus advancement, Hyoid myotomy and suspension, Tongue suspension suture), Dental Sleep Medicine (Maxillomandibular advancement, Custom oral appliances), Hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire)
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Not explicitly mentioned, but Johns Hopkins is a leading academic medical center.
medical_centers.research_programs: Active research programs in sleep medicine with researchers from diverse backgrounds in endocrinology, neurology, psychiatry, and pulmonary medicine.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High, as a major academic medical center.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Aetna, CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield, Cigna Healthcare, First Health, Geisinger Health Plan, Johns Hopkins Health Plans, Kaiser. Patients are advised to confirm with their insurance provider.
medical_centers.notes: The center offers a multidisciplinary team and personalized treatment plans, including both surgical and non-surgical options. They also have a pediatric sleep care program.

medical_centers.name: Northwestern Medicine Sleep Surgery Clinic
medical_centers.address: 676 N Saint Clair St, Suite 1325, Chicago, IL 60611
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Surgery, Obstructive Sleep Apnea, Snoring
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Reena Dhanda-Patil, MD (Otolaryngology)
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Sleep Endoscopy, Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation, Nasal Interventions, Palate Surgery, Skeletal Surgery, Tongue Surgery, Upper Airway Stimulation
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Northwestern Memorial Hospital is nationally ranked in 11 adult specialties by U.S. News & World Report.
medical_centers.research_programs: The Division of Sleep Medicine at Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine conducts clinical trials on sleep disorders. The Sleep Surgery division has a research program focused on understanding obstructive sleep apnea and developing new treatments.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The Northwestern Medicine Sleep Surgery division was the first of its kind to be established in Illinois. They offer a multidisciplinary approach, working closely with the Northwestern Medicine Sleep Health Centers.

medical_centers.name: UCSF Sleep Surgery Center
medical_centers.address: 2380 Sutter Street, San Francisco, CA 94115
medical_centers.specializations: Surgical treatment of sleep-related breathing disorders, obstructive sleep apnea, snoring, innovative surgical techniques, and clinical research.
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Jolie Chang, MD; Megan Durr, MD; Andrew Goldberg, MD, MS
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Expansion Sphincter Pharyngoplasty (ESP), Tonsillectomy, Lingual Tonsillectomy, Transoral Robotic Surgery (TORS), Epiglottoplasty, Hyoid Suspension, Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation (Inspire), Maxillomandibular Advancement (MMA), Drug-Induced Sleep Endoscopy (DISE), and various in-office procedures for snoring and nasal obstruction.
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: UCSF is a leading academic medical center and is consistently ranked among the top hospitals in the nation. While not explicitly designated as a 'Center of Excellence' for sleep surgery, its reputation, research, and the expertise of its surgeons indicate a high level of care.
medical_centers.research_programs: The UCSF Sleep Surgery division's research focuses on several key areas, including improving decision-making for sleep surgery, understanding and addressing barriers to care for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), utilizing digital health and sleep tracking devices to measure treatment outcomes, investigating the physiological changes in laryngeal and pharyngeal sensation in OSA, and studying surgical outcomes and contributing to international consensus statements on OSA.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans are accepted. It is recommended to verify coverage with the center directly.
medical_centers.notes: UCSF has multiple locations. The Sleep Surgery Center is located at the Sutter Street address. The main UCSF Medical Center is at a different location. For sleep surgery inquiries, it is best to use the contact information for the Sleep Surgery division.

medical_centers.name: NYU Langone Health - Division of General Otolaryngology & Sleep Surgery
medical_centers.address: 550 First Avenue, New York, NY 10016
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Surgery, General Otolaryngology, Pediatric Otolaryngology, Sleep Medicine
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Erich P. Voigt, MD (Director, Division of General Otolaryngology and Sleep Surgery), Courtney Chou, MD, Nikhita Jain, MD, Alcibiades J. Rodriguez, MD, Mandana Mahmoudi, MD, PhD, MPH, Rodolfo Miranda, MD, Kammi Grayson, DO, Ari Klapholz, MD
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Laser-assisted uvulopalatoplasty, Cautery-assisted uvulopalatoplasty, Palatal implants (Pillar® procedure), Tongue surgery, Nasal surgery (septoplasty, turbinate reduction), Maxillomandibular advancement, Robotic surgery for obstructive sleep apnea, Inspire upper airway stimulation, Tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: NYU Langone Health is consistently ranked among the top hospitals in the nation by U.S. News & World Report, though a specific designation for sleep surgery was not found.
medical_centers.research_programs: Research focuses on the etiology and pathogenesis of chronic tonsillar hypertrophy and standardizing clinical hearing tests. Dr. Voigt is involved in clinical research on Thyroid and Parathyroid outcomes and Intracapsular Tonsillectomy.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High, as indicated by the large number of sleep medicine specialists and the breadth of procedures offered.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans are accepted. Patients are advised to verify with the hospital.
medical_centers.notes: The program is highly integrated with other specialties, including pulmonology, neurology, and dentistry, to provide comprehensive care. They offer both office-based and inpatient surgical options.

medical_centers.name: Duke Sleep Disorders Center
medical_centers.address: 400 Elf St, Durham, NC 27705
medical_centers.specializations: Comprehensive sleep disorder treatment, advanced surgical options, first fellowship-trained sleep surgeon in North Carolina (Dr. Emily Commesso)
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Emily Commesso, MD; Russell Kahmke, MD; Matthew Ellison, MD
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Nasal surgeries (septoplasty, turbinate reduction), Palatal surgeries (tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty), Tongue procedures (hypoglossal nerve stimulation/Inspire therapy, radiofrequency ablation), Epiglottis procedures, Drug-induced sleep endoscopy
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Yes, accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine. Duke University Hospital is nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report.
medical_centers.research_programs: Current clinical trials are pending IRB approval. The center focuses on a comprehensive, multidisciplinary approach to sleep medicine.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Aetna, Ambetter, Blue Cross Blue Shield of NC, Cigna, Duke Employee Plans, Experience Health, Humana, Medicare, NC Medicaid, TRICARE, United Healthcare
medical_centers.notes: The center is an accredited sleep laboratory on the campus of Duke University Hospital, offering sleep testing for adults and children. Overnight studies require a caregiver for children. Private rooms with amenities are provided. Insurance verification before appointments is recommended.

medical_centers.name: Emory Sleep Center
medical_centers.address: 12 Executive Park Drive Northeast, Atlanta, GA 30329
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Medicine, Pulmonology, Neurology, Epilepsy Neurology
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Donald L Bliwise, PhD; Toral Shah, DO; Meredith Greer, MD; Surina Sharma, MD; David B Rye, MD; Avery Howard Nathanson, MD; David A Schulman, MD, MPH; Kendall James Nichols, MD; Romy Hoque, MD; Lynn Marie Trotti, MD, MSc
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Jaw surgery, Mouth, throat and windpipe surgeries (tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty), Nasal surgeries, Nerve stimulation (Upper airway stimulation), Tongue surgeries, Weight loss surgery
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Yes, accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM)
medical_centers.research_programs: The Emory Sleep Center is involved in a variety of research, including clinical trials. Some of the research areas include the MACS/WIHS Combined Cohort Study, Flumazenil for the Treatment of Primary Hypersomnia, and Clarithromycin for the Treatment of Hypersomnia. They also have a Sleep Medicine Fellowship program.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans, including private and employer-based plans, Federal health insurance marketplace plans, Medicare, Medicare Advantage, and Kaiser Permanente.
medical_centers.notes: The Emory Sleep Center is a leading facility for the diagnosis and treatment of sleep disorders. They offer a comprehensive approach to sleep medicine, with a team of board-certified sleep specialists, nurse practitioners, and sleep technologists. They are also actively involved in research and education.

medical_centers.name: Houston Methodist Sleep Center at Texas Medical Center
medical_centers.address: 6565 Fannin Street, Main Building, 9th Floor, Houston, TX 77030
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep Surgery, Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, multidisciplinary approach to sleep medicine
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Umair Ashraf, MD (Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Leonard Chow, MD (Critical Care Medicine, Pulmonary Critical Care, Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Timothy A. Connolly, MD (Critical Care Medicine, Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Clinton Doerr, MD (Critical Care Medicine, Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Jaya Jacob, NP (Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Scott Richard Sherron, MD (Cardiology, Interventional Cardiology, Sleep Medicine), Mohi U. Syed, MD (Pulmonary Critical Care, Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), J. Georges Youssef, MD (Critical Care Medicine, Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine, Transplant Pulmonology), Faisal Zahiruddin, DO (Pulmonology, Sleep Medicine), Nancy J. Esper, MD (Concierge Medicine, Sleep Medicine)
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Diagnostic sleep studies, Home sleep studies, "Inspire" titration, Multiple sleep latency testing (MSLT), Maintenance of wakefulness testing (MWT), Positive airway pressure (PAP) titration (both continuous and bi-level titrations), Split-night sleep studies, Cephalometric Analysis, Overnight Sleep Study, Breathing Devices (CPAP), Medication, Psychiatric Evaluation, Surgery
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Yes, accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM).
medical_centers.research_programs: The Division Chief of Sleep Surgery will lead innovative research. The program integrates expertise across neurology, respiratory, and cardiac disciplines to develop personalized treatment plans and combines advanced diagnostic tools with groundbreaking research.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans accepted, including Aetna, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Cigna, and United Healthcare. A comprehensive list is available on the website.
medical_centers.notes: The center is actively seeking a Division Chief of Sleep Surgery to develop a premier Sleep Surgery Center. The Houston Methodist Sleep Center is one of the only sleep centers in Houston accredited by the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM).

medical_centers.name: UT Southwestern Medical Center, Department of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery
medical_centers.address: 2001 Inwood Road, 6th and 7th Floor, Dallas, Texas 75390
medical_centers.specializations: Otolaryngology, Endoscopic Ear Surgery, Implanted stimulators for sleep apnea, nasal airway obstruction, sinus disease, salivary gland disorders, thyroid surgery, facial trauma, sleep apnea surgery with implanted hypoglossal nerve stimulators
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Hongzhao Ji, M.D.
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Endoscopic ear surgery, nasal airway obstruction surgery, sinus surgery, salivary gland surgery, thyroid surgery, facial trauma surgery, sleep apnea surgery, hypoglossal nerve stimulation (Inspire)
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Accredited by both the American Academy of Sleep Medicine and the Joint Commission.
medical_centers.research_programs: The department is engaged in almost 100 research projects. The main areas of clinical research are: Pediatric sleep apnea, Skull base tumor bank, Acoustic Neuroma, NF2, Endoscopic ear surgery, Cochlear implants, Paraganglioma, Tumors of head and neck, Tonsillectomy, Voice Disorders.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High. UT Southwestern faculty and residents provide care to more than 140,000 hospitalized patients and oversee approximately 5.1 million outpatient visits annually.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans are accepted, including Aetna, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Cigna, Humana, and United Healthcare. It is recommended to verify coverage directly with the clinical practice or hospital.
medical_centers.notes: The program is described as one of the most advanced sleep and breathing centers in the nation. It is the largest center in North Dallas for narcolepsy patients. The Otolaryngology department has an active research program with almost 100 research projects.

medical_centers.name: University of Michigan Sleep Disorders Center
medical_centers.address: 24 Frank Lloyd Wright Dr, Ann Arbor, MI 48105
medical_centers.specializations: Multidisciplinary approach with specialists from neurology, otolaryngology, pediatrics, psychiatry, and pulmonary medicine, behavioral sleep medicine program for chronic insomnia, sleep disorders in the context of other neurological conditions
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Jeffrey John Stanley, MD; Jayson Greenberg MD, FACS, CPC, ELI-MP; Paul T Hoff MD, MS; Mark E P Prince, MD, FRCS(C), FACS
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP), Upper airway stimulation therapy, Radiofrequency volumetric tissue reduction (RFVTR), Septoplasty and turbinate reduction, Genioglossus advancement, Hyoid suspension, Midline glossectomy and lingualplasty, Maxillomandibular osteotomy (MMO) and advancement (MMA), Palatal implants, Weight loss surgery, Laser-assisted uvuloplasty (LAUP), Tracheostomy
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Yes, nationally recognized by U.S. News & World Report for Pulmonology & Lung Surgery (#14) and Ear, Nose & Throat (#16).
medical_centers.research_programs: The University of Michigan Sleep Disorders Center has a broad research portfolio spanning basic, translational, and clinical research. Key areas of focus include engineering better sleep, sleep across the lifespan, and the interplay of sleep with other medical and neurological conditions such as multiple sclerosis, stroke, Parkinson's disease, and ADHD. They are also involved in developing new diagnostic and management tools for sleep disorders, including mobile apps and novel CPAP technologies.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High (approximately 10,000 clinic visits and 10,000 sleep studies annually)
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans are accepted, but it is recommended to confirm with the insurance company prior to scheduling an appointment.
medical_centers.notes: The University of Michigan Sleep Disorders Center is one of the oldest, largest, and most widely recognized academic sleep programs in the U.S. They have a strong focus on research and a multidisciplinary approach to patient care.

medical_centers.name: University of Washington Sleep Surgery
medical_centers.address: 1959 NE Pacific Street, 3rd Floor, NE 300, Seattle, WA 98195
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep surgery for snoring and obstructive sleep apnea
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Juliana Bonilla-Velez, MD; Maya Sardesai, MD, MEd; Nilesh N. Shah, MD; Edward M. Weaver, MD, MPH
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Nasal Surgery, Airway Surgery, Palate stiffening, Tonsillectomy, Uvulopalatopharyngoplasty (UPPP)
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: No information found
medical_centers.research_programs: The sleep medicine group at UW conducts research on sleep health disparities, sleep apnea treatment adherence, the effects of CPAP on brain function and Alzheimer's biomarkers, care pathways for sleep apnea, the pathophysiology of sleep disorders, and the relationship between sleep-disordered breathing and cardiovascular disease.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The program is part of the UW Department of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery and has clinics at Harborview Medical Center and Seattle Children's Hospital.

medical_centers.name: Cedars-Sinai Sleep Center
medical_centers.address: 8700 Beverly Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90048
medical_centers.specializations: Central sleep apnea (CSA), Circadian rhythm disorders, Hypersomnia, Hypoventilation, Insomnia, Narcolepsy, Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), Parasomnias, Restless legs syndrome
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Dennis M. Tang, MD (Otolaryngology); Martin L. Hopp, MD, PhD (Otolaryngology); Ankona Ghosh, MD (Otolaryngology); Babak Larian, MD (Otolaryngology); Abhita T. Reddy, MD (Otolaryngology); Matthew K. Lee, MD (Otolaryngology); Gene C. Liu, MD (Otolaryngology); Gary S. Bellack, MD (Otolaryngology); David M. Alessi, MD (Otolaryngology, Surgical Oncology); Marc Cohen, MD (Otolaryngology); Ali Namazie, MD (Otolaryngology); Kathryn Kreicher, MD (Otolaryngology); Ashley E. Kita, MD (Otolaryngology); Kaitlynne Pak, MD (Otolaryngology); Neal Deot, MD (Otolaryngology); Tania Hassanzadeh, MD (Otolaryngology)
medical_centers.procedures_offered: CPAP, lifestyle changes, mandibular advancement device, positional therapy, hypoglossal nerve stimulation, surgical interventions to remove airway obstructions or create a wider airway.
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: Yes, #5 in the U.S. for Pulmonology & Lung Surgery and highly ranked for Ear, Nose & Throat by U.S. News & World Report.
medical_centers.research_programs: Active research in new treatments, techniques, and technologies for lung diseases. The pulmonary research team at the Women's Guild Lung Institute is comprised of world-class researchers spanning multiple disciplines.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance plans
medical_centers.notes: Offers a multidisciplinary team of experts, including specialists in ear, nose, and throat care, lung conditions, and sleep medicine. Virtual second opinion service is available.

medical_centers.name: UPMC Sleep Medicine Center
medical_centers.address: 1400 Locust St., Building A, 4th Floor, Room 4412, Pittsburgh, PA 15219
medical_centers.specializations: Sleep apnea, snoring, insomnia, restless leg syndrome, narcolepsy, medical and surgical sleep-disordered breathing, sedated endoscopy, neurostimulation therapy
medical_centers.key_surgeons: Ryan J. Soose, MD; Mazen El Ali, MD; Ravi Alagar, MD, FCCP, FRCPC; Charles Atwood, MD; Rachel Givelber, MD; Laurie Kilkenny, MD; David Kristo, MD; Sanjay Patel, MD; Andrew Perez, MD; Patrick Strollo, MD; Maria Sunseri, MD, FAASM
medical_centers.procedures_offered: Hypoglossal nerve stimulator implant (Inspire), Nasal surgery (septoplasty, turbinate reduction), Pharyngeal surgery (tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, reconstructive procedures), Skeletal surgery (maxillomandibular advancement - MMA), CPAP therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, medication
medical_centers.center_of_excellence: The Sleep Center at UPMC Williamsport Divine Providence Campus has earned its fourth consecutive reaccreditation from the American Academy of Sleep Medicine (AASM).
medical_centers.research_programs: The Sleep Surgery Division is involved in pioneering research for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), focusing on optimizing patient selection, refining surgical techniques, and tailoring therapy. Dr. Ryan Soose was instrumental in the STAR trial, which led to the FDA approval of the Inspire Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulator System.
medical_centers.patient_volume: High. The UPMC Mercy Sleep Medicine Center performs approximately 1,300 sleep studies annually, and the UPMC Sleep Medicine Center conducts about 2,000 in-lab adult sleep studies each year.
medical_centers.insurance_accepted: Most major insurance
medical_centers.notes: The center is a multidisciplinary program incorporating respiratory medicine, psychiatry, otolaryngology, and bariatric surgery specialists. A physician referral is required for evaluation and treatment.

independent_clinics.name: Sleep Apnea Surgery Center

Published more than 100 scientific articles and book chapters on sleep apnea surgery and maxillofacial surgery. Internationally recognized expert in sleep apnea surgery.
independent_clinics.patient_reviews: The website provides a comprehensive list of patient experiences, categorized by procedure. The reviews are overwhelmingly positive, with patients frequently describing Dr. Li as a life-saver and praising his expertise and compassionate care. Many patients report significant improvement in their sleep apnea symptoms and overall quality of life after surgery.
independent_clinics.insurance_accepted: Accepts all PPO insurance plans, but is an out-of-network provider.
independent_clinics.unique_services: Developed the EASE (Endoscopically-Assisted Surgical Expansion) procedure in 2017 to maximize nasal airway expansion while minimizing side effects.

independent_clinics.patient_reviews: 4.8/5 stars based on 107 reviews. Patients praise his expertise, communication, and friendly demeanor.
independent_clinics.unique_services: Dual board certification in Sleep and Surgery. Works to advance and improve treatment of sleep disorders and sleep apnea.

independent_clinics.patient_reviews: Dr. Capasso is often described as courteous and helpful. People appreciate that he listens to their concerns, addresses them thoroughly, and explains things clearly. Many find him to be friendly and value the care he provides. Some also noted his knowledge and preparedness. (4.9/5 based on 45 ratings)

independent_clinics.name: ADVENT

independent_clinics.notable_achievements: Founder of ADVENT, which has grown to over 35 locations in six states. Dr. Kandula was the first surgeon in Wisconsin to perform Balloon Sinuplasty. ADVENT has received numerous awards, including being named to the Milwaukee Business Journal's 'Best Places to Work' and 'Fastest Growing Firms' lists.
independent_clinics.patient_reviews: ADVENT has over 5,000 Google reviews with a high average rating. Patients frequently praise the efficiency of the practice, the effectiveness of the treatments, and the caring and professional staff. Some negative reviews on the BBB website mention high costs and unsuccessful treatments.
independent_clinics.unique_services: ADVENT's approach is centered around "The Breathing Triangle®," a concept developed by Dr. Kandula that focuses on the nose and throat as the starting point for all breathing and sleep issues. The practice emphasizes simple, in-office procedures with minimal downtime.
